abstracts.cdata!:
Project ratings show a satisfactory
            outcome, highly likely sustainability, and substantial
            institutional development impacts. Findings identified to
            have implications for subsequent operations include: 1)
            during implementation it became clear it is important to
            stand firmly by prior actions, and triggers in the PAF
            matrix, as agreed with the Government and donors. Small
            deviations from actions intended in the agreed PAF, can
            cause unnecessary disagreements. Thus, subsequent operations
            should use even the same wording as in selected prior
            actions and triggers; 2) budgetary support is evidently,
            more effective if provided in coordination with other
            donors' assistance, concurrent with the
            Government's budget process. The following second
            operation has been aligned with the budget process, and
            subsequent poverty reduction support credits will follow the
            same line of thought; and, 3) project experience showed that
            timing of reform implementation would be more realistic if
            electoral cycles are taken into consideration, for example,
            the labor law and procurement law were designed to be
            approved during an election year, but subsequently delayed.
